text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The authorities allow candidates to use French on the Algerian French-language radio during poll campaign.
- The government grants a 10-day-secondment period for mayors and teachers involved in the June 5 parliamentary poll.
- The authorities, emboldened by tax collection increase in 1996, set up a task-force to look into legislation loopholes permeating tax evasion.
- Religious Affairs Minister Ahmed Merani said his department "froze" the activities of mosque imams who are candidates for the 380-seat National Assembly election.
- Masterminds of latest bomb attacks aim to create a terror climate to force voters to stay away from the poll stations.
- Army troops build a Diar Errahma building complex to house the poor and homeless.
- Interior minister says government has marked out 1,300 places where candidates can meet voters.
